com.google.crypto.tink.apps.rewardedads

Class RewardedAdsVerifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.crypto.tink.apps.rewardedads.RewardedAdsVerifier

  • public final class RewardedAdsVerifier
extends Object
    An implementation of the verifier side of Server-Side Verification of Google AdMob Rewarded Ads.

    Typical usage: 

    
 RewardedAdsVerifier verifier = new RewardedAdsVerifier.Builder()
     .fetchVerifyingPublicKeysWith(
         RewardedAdsVerifier.KEYS_DOWNLOADER_INSTANCE_PROD)
     .build();
 String rewardUrl = ...;
 verifier.verify(rewardUrl);

    This usage ensures that you always have the latest public keys, even when the keys were recently rotated. It will fetch and cache the latest public keys from {#PUBLIC_KEYS_URL_PROD}. When the cache expires, it will re-fetch the public keys. When initializing your server, we also recommend that you call KeysDownloader.refreshInBackground() of RewardedAdsVerifier.KEYS_DOWNLOADER_INSTANCE_PROD to proactively fetch the public keys.

    If you've already downloaded the public keys and have other means to manage key rotation, you can use RewardedAdsVerifier.Builder.setVerifyingPublicKeys(java.lang.String) to set the public keys. The Builder also allows you to customize other properties.

    • Method Detail

      • verify

        public void verify(String rewardUrl)
            throws GeneralSecurityException
        Verifies that rewardUrl has a valid signature.

        This method requires that the name of the last two query parameters of rewardUrl are SIGNATURE_PARAM_NAME and KEY_ID_PARAM_NAME in that order.

        Throws:
        GeneralSecurityException
